chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
tri_ins (Nil nat) = Nil nat

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
tri_ins = fix tri_ins (l : list nat) : list nat := match l with | @Nil _ => Nil nat | @Cons _ n x => ins n (tri_ins x) end : list nat -> list nat
Nil : forall X : Set, list X
ins_eq1 : forall n : nat, ins n (Nil nat) = Cons nat n (Nil nat)
sorted_eq1 = eq_refl : sorted (Nil nat) = True
nocc_eq1 : forall n : nat, nocc n (Nil nat) = 0
ins = fix ins (n : nat) (l : list nat) {struct l} : list nat := match l with | @Nil _ => Cons nat n (Nil nat) | @Cons _ m x => si (list nat) (inf_egal n m) (Cons nat n (Cons nat m x)) (Cons nat m (ins n x)) end : nat -> list nat -> list nat Arguments ins _%nat_scope
sorted_eq2 : forall n : nat, sorted (Cons nat n (Nil nat)) = True
Inductive list (X : Set) : Set := Nil : list X | Cons : X -> list X -> list X Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments Nil _%type_scope Arguments Cons _%type_scope
Nat.shiftr = fun a : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => nat) a (fun _ : nat => Nat.div2) : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => nat) n Arguments Nat.shiftr (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.shiftl = fun a : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => nat) a (fun _ : nat => Nat.double) : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => nat) n Arguments Nat.shiftl (_ _)%nat_scope
ins_eq2 : forall (n m : nat) (x : list nat), ins n (Cons nat m x) = si (list nat) (inf_egal n m) (Cons nat n (Cons nat m x)) (Cons nat m (ins n x))
sorted_eq3 : forall (n m : nat) (x : list nat), sorted (Cons nat n (Cons nat m x)) = (inf_egal n m = true /\ sorted (Cons nat m x))
PeanoNat.Nat.add_wd_obligation_1 = fun (x y : nat) (H : x = y) (x0 y0 : nat) (H0 : x0 = y0) => eq_ind_r (fun x1 : nat => x + x1 = y + y0) (eq_ind_r (fun x1 : nat => x1 + y0 = y + y0) eq_refl H) H0 : Morphisms.respectful eq (Morphisms.respectful eq eq) Nat.add Nat.add
PeanoNat.Nat.mod_wd_obligation_1 = fun (x y : nat) (H : x = y) (x0 y0 : nat) (H0 : x0 = y0) => eq_ind_r (fun x1 : nat => PeanoNat.Nat.modulo x x1 = PeanoNat.Nat.modulo y y0) (eq_ind_r (fun x1 : nat => PeanoNat.Nat.modulo x1 y0 = PeanoNat.Nat.modulo y y0) eq_refl H) H0 : Morphisms.respectful eq (Morphisms.respectful eq eq) PeanoNat.Nat.modulo PeanoNat.Nat.modulo
sorted_inf : forall (n m : nat) (x : list nat), sorted (Cons nat n (Cons nat m x)) -> inf_egal n m = true
nocc = fix nocc (n : nat) (l : list nat) {struct l} : nat := match l with | @Nil _ => 0 | @Cons _ m x => si nat (egal_nat n m) (S (nocc n x)) (nocc n x) end : nat -> list nat -> nat Arguments nocc _%nat_scope
nocc_eq2 : forall (n m : nat) (x : list nat), nocc n (Cons nat m x) = si nat (egal_nat n m) (S (nocc n x)) (nocc n x)
Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.pow (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.gcd = fix gcd (a b : nat) {struct a} : nat := match a with | 0 => b | S a' => gcd (Nat.modulo b (S a')) (S a') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.gcd (_ _)%nat_scope
List.seq = fix seq (start len : nat) {struct len} : Datatypes.list nat := match len with | 0 => nil | S len0 => (start :: seq (S start) len0)%list end : nat -> nat -> Datatypes.list nat Arguments List.seq (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.min = fix min (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S n' => match m with | 0 => 0 | S m' => S (min n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.min (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n' => match m with | 0 => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.max (_ _)%nat_scope

sorted_cdr : forall (n : nat) (x : list nat), sorted (Cons nat n x) -> sorted x
PeanoNat.Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
inf_egal = fix inf_egal (n m : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => true | S n0 => match m with | 0 => false | S m0 => inf_egal n0 m0 end end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments inf_egal (_ _)%nat_scope

PeanoNat.Nat.lnot = fun a n : nat => PeanoNat.Nat.lxor a (PeanoNat.Nat.ones n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.lnot (_ _)%nat_scope

sorted = fix sorted (l : list nat) : Prop := match l with | @Nil _ => True | @Cons _ n (@Nil _) => True | @Cons _ n (@Cons _ m _ as l0) => inf_egal n m = true /\ sorted l0 end : list nat -> Prop

Nat.lxor = fun a b : nat => Nat.bitwise xorb (Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lxor (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.lor = fun a b : nat => Nat.bitwise orb (Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lor (_ _)%nat_scope
